Managing Hosts in Ansible provisioning tool

Adding the server to ansible provisioning tool

  1. Create the user “awxadm” and add it to taunix group so it has all the sudo privileges.
    sudo useradd -g taunix  -c "Ansible_admin" -d /home/awadm  -m awxadm
  2. Change the password 
    echo awxadm:savuqBIhp6PJo|sudo chpasswd -e

    OR

  3. Password for awxadm is stored in secret server awxadm password
  4. Make sure the server has Python 2.7 or Python 3.5 and above.
    inampk48@sfldmilx031:~> python -V 
Python 2.7.18
  5. When the server have more than one version installed in it, make sure you link the correct Python version to /usr/bin/python
    inampk48@sfldmilx031:~> ls -lrt /usr/bin/python
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 9 Apr 27  2021 /usr/bin/python -> python2.7
  6. Then log in to the Ansible Web URLhttps://pcdcawxlxap01:8043/#/home
  7. Admin login credentials are stored in secret server admin password
  8. Click on inventories and select the inventory where you want to add the server to
  9. After you've chosen the inventory click on “Hosts” and then click on “Add” as shown in the below picture
  10. Fill in the details like name description and under variables make sure you put the FQDN as shown below 
    ansible_host: FQDN 
eg: ansible_host: sfldmiax140.driv.com

  11. After the server is added associate it with the group like AIX, SUSE or Red Hat as shown in the below picture
  12. Test the server for communication select the server and click on run command as shown in the below picture
  13. Choose the module as “ping” and the credentials as “awxadm”
  14. After you have launched it you should see the ping output as successful

Removing the server from ansible provisioning tool

  1. To remove a server log into the ansible webpage click on “Hosts” search for the server you want to remove select the server and click on “Delete” as shown in the below screenshot
